body.name: A Virgin for the Highland Beast: A Highlanders Historical Romance Novel (Lasses of Clan Clyde Book 1)
body.description: “If ye want me to touch ye, ye have to say so, wife…”Running for their lives, Emma and her sisters end up in the Beast's lands. And he catches them. Now they are at the mercy of their brother's killer...Laird Hunter may be notorious for his cruelty, but when four lasses seek refuge in his castle, he can’t turn them away. And he knows exactly what —or who— he wants in return: Emma.To protect her sisters, the fiery lass agrees to marry him. But she vows to keep her distance from her new husband. Even if she quivers under the Laird’s heated gaze…*A Virgin for the Highland Beast is a steamy Scottish historical romance novel of 60,000 words (around 300 pages) written by Eloise Madigan and published by Cobalt Fairy.No cheating, no cliffhangers, lots of steam and a happy ending.Get this book for free with Kindle Unlimited! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I could not put it down
reviews.reviewText: Sisters Nora, Emma, Isobel and Lydia flee from their home when Geoffrey, their cousin and Laird, imprisons one to blackmail the other. Lost, tired and cold, they stumble onto a castle where they ask Hunter, the Laird of Mac Ross Castle, for sanctuary. He agrees on one condition. One of the sisters will have to agree to marry him. The table is set for conflict, drama and retribution. There is a black cloud that hangs over most of this story, and if you read the prequel (which I suggest you do), you will understand why. That, along with Geoffrey’s power-driven insanity, sets the stage for an emotionally charged tale where the reader is constantly waiting for the other shoe to drop. You will find some humor and a few steamy moments sprinkled in to lighten the atmosphere, and in the end, love develops and brightness prevails. This is one of those stories that draws you in right from the beginning. The characters are varied and believable. They include a deranged villain, a damaged laird, four very different sisters, and a loyal sidekick who is also Hunter’s man-in-arms. There are horrors that will break your heart and your stomach may be tied in knots, but you will keep reading because this is just one of those books that you simply cannot put down.
